instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: Hi, I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with the infamous question mark folder. I saw a video of the 1706 witch has a failing probe point in many cases. Any know issues for this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 15 inch touchbar with regards to SSD drives failing?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message:
Is Lifeboat bypass connected?
Also check if you get all SSD voltages.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: Yes connected. No short on all SSD powerlines. I get 3.3v and 1.8v but both then drop to 0v One capacitor looks like its a bit corroded, measures still OK though no short on that one. Its <CAPACITOR>C9390</CAPACITOR> pin 1 thats a bit corroded.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message:
If SSD voltages drop, is the reason of question mark folder.
All SSD voltages must come and stay on.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: So i reassembled the machine, running on battery power. I have all voltages 12v, 1.8v and 3.3v should there be something else?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: I have <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.2v. <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> =3.25v, SSD Nand has 1.2 and 1.8v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message:
Found a short, now I have following issue. The board is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A and I have the boardview and schematics for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, doesnt say A. Mostly looks identical but the area where I found the short is slightly different, see attached image from my boardview as well as the board in question. Is there different versions of this board?

PS sorry i wrote the model wrong in the tittle

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message:
Be sure to have schematic and boardview for Baffin2,
Baffin (X363G) is 00281.

Where did you find the short?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder

Why did you spend money for schematic, instead of asking here???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: I always buy them, fast :) The IC that are shorted are not in Baffin2 so we have no clue what line is shorted. I have emailed my schematics supplier maybe by now he has the correct one. WIll let you know if I got it. If you need schematics here are a lot listed for free -> [url]https://download.itadmins.net/Schematics/Apple/Macbook/[/url]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: Just to make it clear, I have schematics for Baffin and Baffin2. The corresponsing boardviews that came with these are identical, just named different 281 and 928. Maybe its just the wrong boardview that was included and the scematics is OK.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: That shorted power rail should go to some connector, or another easy component to locate on boardview...
